title: Paging
subject: Operating Systems
theory:
Solves External Fragmentation. Divide Physical Memory into blocks (**Frames**). Divide Logical Memory into blocks (**Pages**). 
OS maintains a **Page Table** to map Page N -> Frame M. 
Hardware **TLB** caches these mappings for speed.

common_mistakes.correction: No External, but Internal Fragmentation exists in the last page (if process size isn't multiple of page size).

interview_questions.question: What is TLB hit ratio?
interview_questions.answer: Percentage of times translation is found in cache. Critical for performance (RAM access is slow).
